resources.string: Hi! This app is designed to allow family and friends to find each other\'s location on demand. It does not track you constantly nor does it store or share any of your data with any 3rd party. \nYou need to explicitly allow a phone number to be able to request location data from LocateMe installed on your phone or you need to send it to someone.

LocateMe requires SMS access permissions to enable the functionality of sending and receiving messages. With them - LocateMe can send SMS messages to your friends and family to let them know your location as well as receive messages from them. It\'s vital for the app to function!

Location permissions are necessary for LocateMe to retrieve the device\'s geographic coordinates. When you grant location permissions, the app gain privilege to request the precise location of the device, which is essential for providing accurate location updates to your family and friends.

Here is the list of contacts you wish to use LocateMe with. Once you add any via button at the bottom of the screen, you can tap on a contact which will show you all the available options. From right to left, those are: 
- Remove contact, 
- Disallow given contact from being able to check your location, 
- Request contact's location(Note: given contact must have you added and allow you to do so,
- Send your location to contact(That doesn't require another person to even use LocateMe :)).
Stay safe!\nIf you need any further explanations on how the app works:\nPress here to see help! :)
